title: Want a free Miller Lite? You need to 'unfollow' the brand on social media first
text:
Miller Lite wants to give you a beer. For free.

The catch is that you have to "unfollow" Miller Lite's Facebook and Instagram pages.

The brew's new advertising campaign is aimed at Millennials and a perceived dependence on social media. A MillerCoors study showed that half of drinkers ages 21 to 27 years old meet with their close friends in person fewer than a few times a month.

Enter director Ringan Ledwidge and his artsy anti-influencer commercial. The spot encourages going out for a beer with the theme "a few friends are better than a few thousand followers," and calls Miller Lite "the original social media."

Miller Lite's new ad campaign launches with free beer. (Photo: MillerCoors)

MillerCoors launches the spot today during the World Series and with the free beer offer. Here are the steps you need to follow.

Text a photo or screenshot showing you unfollowed Miller Lite on Instagram or Facebook to 49375 and include keyword “UNFOLLOW.”

Wait for Miller Lite to send a link.

Upload a receipt from a Miller Lite purchase.

Miller Lite will credit your PayPal account back for your first round of Miller (up to $8).

Here's what else you need to know: The free beer is limited to the first 118,000 submissions.

The rebate offer expires Nov. 29 or while supplies last, whichever occurs first. Purchases must occur between Oct. 22 and Nov. 22. A receipt must be submitted by Dec. 6. There are more details at millerlite.com/unfollow.
